definition: the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])

sentences.english: Though you have solemnly vowed yourself loyal to His Majesty's Court.
sentences.chinese: 丞相信誓旦旦說自己沒有篡奪漢室之意。

sentences.english: The prime minister YuWenHuaJi in order to take the throne with collude with the turks.
sentences.chinese: 丞相宇文化及爲了奪取皇位同突厥暗中勾結。

sentences.english: Liu Xin want to resort to the prime minister Hole's support, was rejected. As a result, Dr.
sentences.chinese: 劉歆又想求助於丞相孔光的支持，也遭到了拒絕。

sentences.english: Prime minister into east in front of the face of prince said to disband east guard.
sentences.chinese: 丞相入東宮當着太子的面表示要解散東宮衛隊。

sentences.english: He was so great that everyone in the state of Shu loved him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個好丞相，所有的蜀國人都很愛戴他。

sentences.english: Everybody sneered at his bad handwriting , and the prime minister himself really didn t care.
sentences.chinese: 大家都譏笑他的書法不佳，丞相倒也毫不在意。

definition: the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
senior provincial official in imperial China
Li Si (c. 280-208 BC), Legalist philosopher, calligrapher and prime minister of Qin kingdom and Qin dynasty from 246 to 208 BC
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
(army) commander-in-chief (archaic)/provincial military governor and civil administrator during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
Grand Servant in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
